### Revision Function

redefine the function
```{r}
plot_trajectory_symmetry_revision <- function (res, typ = "substrate", plot_log10 = FALSE) 
{
    measures <- get_symmetry_measurements(res)
    if ("a_O" %in% colnames(res)) {
        res <- res %>% rename(aO = a_O) %>% mutate(recovery = ifelse(direction == 
            "up", "oxic", "anoxic")) %>% select(-direction)
        sym.flag <- F
    } else {
        res <- res %>% select(-starts_with("PB"), -SO)
        sym.flag <- T
    }
    if (!(typ %in% c("bacteria", "substrate"))) {
        stop("Type must be either 'bacteria' 'or substrate'")
    }
    measures <- measures %>% mutate(species = rownames(.)) %>% 
        gather(key = "measure", value = "value", 
            -species) %>% mutate(type = ifelse(species %in% c("SO", 
        "SR", "P", "O"), "substrate", 
        "bacteria")) %>% filter(type == typ, !(species %in% 
        c("P", "SO"))) %>% spread(key = measure, 
        value = value)

    
      res_ox <- res %>% {
          if (sym.flag) 
              select(., starts_with("CB"), "O", 
                "aO", "aS", "recovery")
          else select(., starts_with("CB"), "O", 
              "aO", "recovery")
      } %>% {
          if (sym.flag) 
              gather(data = ., key = "species", value = "state", 
                -c(aO, aS, recovery))
          else gather(data = ., key = "species", value = "state", 
              -c(aO, recovery))
      } %>% mutate(type = ifelse(species == "O", "substrate", 
          "bacteria"))
      res_anox <- res %>% {
          if (sym.flag) 
              select(., starts_with("SB"), "SR", 
                "aO", "aS", "recovery")
          else select(., starts_with("SB"), "SR", 
              "aO", "recovery")
      } %>% {
          if (sym.flag) 
              gather(data = ., key = "species", value = "state", 
                -c(aO, aS, recovery))
          else gather(data = ., key = "species", value = "state", 
              -c(aO, recovery))
      } %>% mutate(type = ifelse(species == "SR", "substrate", 
          "bacteria"))
      plt.seg <- data.frame(species = c(measures$species,rev(measures$species)) , 
                            x = c(measures$anox_TP[1], measures$ox_TP[2], measures$anox_TP[2], measures$ox_TP[1]), 
                            y = c(measures$state_anox_TP[1], measures$state_ox_TP[2], measures$state_anox_TP[2], measures$state_ox_TP[1]), 
                            xend = c(measures$anox_TPafter[1], measures$ox_TPafter[2], measures$anox_TPafter[2], measures$ox_TPafter[1]),  
                            yend = c(measures$state_anox_TPafter[1], measures$state_ox_TPafter[2], measures$state_anox_TPafter[2],measures$state_ox_TPafter[1]))
    
    plt.traj <- rbind(res_ox, res_anox)
    na_mask <- which((plt.traj$recovery == "anoxic" & plt.traj$aO <= 
        measures$ox_TP & plt.traj$aO >= measures$ox_TPafter) | 
        (plt.traj$recovery == "oxic" & plt.traj$aO >= measures$anox_TP & 
            plt.traj$aO < measures$anox_TPafter))
    plt.traj[na_mask + 1, "state"] <- NA
    if (plot_log10) {
        plt.traj$state <- log10(abs(plt.traj$state))
        plt.seg[, c("y", "yend")] <- log10(plt.seg[, 
            c("y", "yend")])
    }
    plt.seg <- plt.seg %>% mutate(plot_species = recode(species, 
        O = "Oxygen", CB_1 = "Cyanobacteria", SR = "Sulfide", 
        SB_1 = "Sulfur-reducing bacteria"))
    plt.traj <- plt.traj %>% mutate(plot_species = recode(species, 
        O = "Oxygen", CB_1 = "Cyanobacteria", SR = "Sulfide", 
        SB_1 = "Sulfur-reducing bacteria"))
    
    ### change here ###
    p <- ggplot(data = plt.traj %>% filter(type == typ)) + geom_segment(data = plt.seg, 
        mapping = aes(x = x, y = y, xend = xend, yend = yend, 
            color = plot_species), lineend = "round", linejoin = "round", 
        linewidth = 0.5, linetype = "dotted", arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.3, 
            "cm"))) + geom_path(mapping = aes(x = aO, y = state, 
        color = plot_species)) + scale_color_manual(values = c("#e85050", 
        "#5da1df")) + 
      labs(x = expression(Log[10](Oxygen ~ diffusivity) ~ "[" * 
            hr^-1 * "]"), y = expression(Log[10](Concentration) ~ 
            "[mM]"), color = "type")
      
    if (sym.flag) {
        if (length(unique(plt.traj$aS)) > 1) {
            t_func <- function(a) {
                approx(x = unique(plt.traj$aO), y = unique(plt.traj$aS), 
                  xout = a, method = "linear", rule = 1)$y
            }
            p <- p + scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), sec.axis = sec_axis(trans = . ~ 
                t_func(.), name = expression(Log[10](Sulfide ~ 
                Diffusivity) ~ "[" * hr^-1 * "]")))
        }
    }
    return(p)
}
```

### Figure 1

```{r figure_1cd, echo=FALSE, fig.height=6, fig.width=6}
# point to directory from project
wd <- "data/bush-sim"
# figure 1c, d: asymmetry in magnitudes in bush simulation
bush_res <- readRDS(file.path(wd, "simulation_bush_temporal.RDS"))

fig_1a <- ggplot() + theme(panel.background = element_blank()) + 
  labs(x = "Environmental driver", y = "Concentration") + 
  my_theme + 
  theme(axis.title.y = element_text(size = textsize, margin = margin(t = 0, r = margin.r)))

fig_1b <- ggplot() + theme(panel.background = element_blank()) + 
  labs(x = "Environmental driver") + 
  my_theme

fig_1c <- plot_trajectory_symmetry(res = bush_res, trajectory = "recovery", typ = "substrate") + 
  labs(y = expression(Log[10](Concentration)~"[μM]"), x = expression(Log[10](Oxygen~Diffusivity)~"["*hr^-1*"]")) +
  my_theme +
  theme(axis.title.y = element_text(size = textsize, margin = margin(r=margin.r)), 
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = textsize, margin = margin(t=margin.t)))

fig_1d <- plot_trajectory_symmetry(res = bush_res, trajectory = "collapse", typ = "substrate") + 
  labs(x = expression(Log[10](Oxygen~Diffusivity)~"["*hr^-1*"]")) + 
  my_theme + 
  theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size = , margin = margin(t=margin.t)))


# it needs a patchwork theme as well as a theme for the plots
# (fig_1a | fig_1b) / (fig_1c | fig_1d) 
wrap_plots(fig_1a, fig_1b, fig_1c, fig_1d) +
  plot_layout(ncol = 2, guide = "collect") +
  guides(color = guide_legend(position = "bottom")) +
  plot_annotation(tag_levels = "a") &
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")

# ggarrange(fig_1a, fig_1b, fig_1c, fig_1d, common.legend = TRUE, legend = "bottom")
```

### Figure 3

```{r figure_3, eval = FALSE, echo = FALSE, fig.width=6, fig.height = 6}

# figure 3: dynamics
dyn_res <- readRDS(file.path("data", "symmetric-sim" , "simulation_time_dynamics_symmetric.RDS" ))
# calculate starting of time series
starting <- which(dyn_res$result$aO == 0)[1]
# recode for proper legends

df3 <- dyn_res$result %>% 
  # slice(starting:nrow(.)) %>% 
  dplyr::select(c(O, aO, aS, time, SR, P)) %>%
  mutate_at(c("O", "SR", "P"), log10) %>%
  gather(key = species, value = concentration, -time) %>%
  mutate(panel = ifelse(species %in% c("O", "SR"), "substrates",
                        ifelse(species %in% c("aO", "aS"), "diffusivities", 
                              "nutrient"))) %>% 
  mutate(species_plot = recode(species, 
                                O = "Oxygen", 
                                SR = "Sulfide",
                                aO = "Oxygen Diffusivity",
                                aS = "Sulfide Diffusisivity",
                                P = "Phosphate"
                               ))

fig3a<- ggplot(data = df3 %>% filter(panel == "diffusivities"), 
               mapping = aes(x = time, y = concentration, color = species_plot)) + 
          labs(x = "", y = expression(Log[10](Diffusivity)~"["*hr^-1*"]")) +
          geom_path(linetype = "dashed") + 
          scale_color_manual(values = c("#e85050", "#5da1df")) +
          theme(axis.title.x = element_blank())

fig3b <- ggplot(data = df3 %>% filter(panel == "substrates"), 
                mapping = aes(x = time, y= concentration, color = species_plot)) +
        geom_step()  +
        labs(x = "", y = expression(Log[10](Concentration)~"[μM]")) + # [μM]
        scale_color_manual(values = c("#e85050", "#5da1df")) +
        theme(axis.title.x = element_blank())

fig3c <- ggplot(data = df3 %>% filter(panel == "nutrient"),
                mapping = aes(x = time, y = concentration, color = species_plot)) +
            geom_step() +
        labs(x  = "Time [hr]", y = expression(Log[10](Concentration)~"[μM]")) +
        scale_color_manual(values = c("#674ea7")) + 
        theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size = textsize,
                                          margin = margin(t=10)))

wrap_plots(fig3a, fig3b, fig3c) + 
  plot_layout(ncol = 1, guide = "collect") +
  plot_annotation(tag_levels = "a") & 
  my_theme & 
  theme(axis.line.x = element_line(arrow = grid::arrow(length = unit(0.2, "cm"),
                                                      ends = "last")), 
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = textsize, margin = margin(t = 0, r = 3))
        )
# todo: y axis labels, x axis label
```
